September 1, 1950
Mr. Richard B. Hull
TfSOI, Iowa State College
Ames, Iowa
Dear Dick:
I am tremendously grateful to you for picking up
the cudgels, as indicated in the copies of your letters to Allen
and Waldo* I’m sure you’ll be able to calm the situation down*
It occurs to me that this is the twenty-fifth
anniversary of NAEB, and it might not be a bad idea to arrange
for the promotion of an hour or two-hour show which would
include greetings from the presidents of all member institutions
and also Hennock, Senator Johnson, Coy,etc. Certainly, there
ought to be musical contributions from each of the stations. The
whole show should be taped, and sufficient copies made so that
it could be presented on all stations of the network simultaneously.
Sener could probably jazz the production up with plenty of Hollywood
names, and the whole thing might well lend itself to national
publicity.
P.S. I don’t know why NBC, ABC, and Columbia, might not be prepared
to put on a national salute to HAEB over their own networks.
P.P.S. I leave the TV picture to you#
"The
Voice Of Tfie City
